title: What are 10 reasons for not teaching cursive writing in school for kindergarten? - Quora

response.answer_text: D’ neilian is sometime taught in kindergarten. It is rare to learn cursive in kindergarten but it can happen. Public schools are starting to stop teaching cursive because it is not in demand by employers.Cursive is often too demanding for young children.Kindergarten is supposed to create an academic base to introduce kids to schools and prepare them for the future. Cursive is not as valued as it was in the past.Keyboarding is more valued by society and business.Very few high schools accept papers and projects that are in cursive.Colleges very rarely accept papers that are in cursive.Many college professors want papers/ term papers/ finals to be downloaded through the internet. These papers must be typed.Resumes must be typed or downloaded to be taken seriously. Please feel free to create a resume in cursive— but you won’t get an interview.Many jobs require applicants to apply using the internet or a specific website. Keyboarding gets people jobs.Employers expect employees to use email and other electronic forms of communications.Social media relies on keyboarding.Parents can still teach their children cursive outside of school.Youtube offers great lesson on cursive.Times are changing. Keyboards and computers are the way people communicate.

Kids that age have not perfected the fine motor control needed for good cursive writing - the ones that look like calligraphy. I had “cursive writing” when I was in grade 2 and 3 in Singapore. I absolutely HATED it. my hand would cramp up trying to etch out those beautiful curves, although in my case, no doctor’s written prescription could have been worse. Even today, i can’t read my handwriting, and my cursive is just plain ugly. It’s like forcing a kid to write chinese characters over and over and over - because that’s the way it’s taught. You just end up hating the subject and topic.
